title: thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<dyn Any>', on Nightly Rust for a few days now

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Hi, our CI builds have been consistently failing and we cannot build a docker image with the latest nightly. You can find the CI run [here](https://github.com/purpleprotocol/purplecoin/actions/runs/4921527517/jobs/8791450140). ### Meta ``` 2023-05-09, rust version 1.71.0-nightly (2f2c438dc 2023-05-08) ``` ### Error output ``` #12 386.6 query stack during panic: #12 386.6 #0 [collect_and_partition_mono_items] collect_and_partition_mono_items #12 386.6 end of query stack #12 386.6 error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_monomorphize/src/collector.rs:1038:9: no MIR available for DefId(29:2585 ~ wgpu_core[0d9b]::track::texture::{impl#2}::change) #12 386.6 #12 386.6 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/2f2c438dce75d8cc532c3baa849eeddc0901802c/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1650:9 ```
Backtrace
